question.text: All the statements about the members of the Liliaceae family are false except

options.text: The length of filaments in all stamens is the same.
They have leaves without stipules but show parallel venation.
They have a trilocular superior ovary with three ovules
They have fruits which are mostly berries and rarely capsule

solution.text: Members of the Liliaceae family have 6 stamens, three with long stamens and three with short stamens. They have a tricarpellary, syncarpous gynoecium with an ovary which is superior, trilocular with many ovules and has axile placentation. They have fruits which are mostly capsules (dry and dehiscent) and rarely berries (Fleshy fruits). They also show alternate phyllotaxy with linearleaves without stipule and with parallel venation.
